Steve is the President and Founder of Mediacentric, Inc. With over 25 years of experience in the publishing and advertising world, Steve brings a wealth of knowledge and expertise to servicing his clients who include some of the biggest names in the media business. Steve is well-rounded with advertising, marketing and proven sales leadership capabilities in multi-media sales (digital, mobile, social networking and traditional), as well as direct experience on the agency and client sides of the business as well as managing aspects of running a businessâ€“ he is indeed â€œMediacentric.â€

Prior to starting his own company, Steve worked in a variety of senior management and executive level sales positions for various media and magazine publishing companies, including Gruner & Jahr, a division of Bertelsmann, where Steve was responsible for creating and developing the Business Innovator Group and overseeing joint National cross-platform media and sponsorship sales for Inc. and Fast Company magazines. Prior to that and most notably, Steve was Senior Vice President and Group Publisher of The Industry Standard and TheStandard.com, where he and his team launched the magazine and achieved record sales of 7,600 ad pages in 2000, more than any magazine in history and grew print and digital sales revenues from $2.5 million in 1999 to $112 million in 2000, achieving a 60% profit margin. Before The Standard, Steve held sales leadership roles at Ziff-Davis, Inc. Magazine and Playboy Enterprises.

Steve started his career on the agency side of the business, working as an Account Executive at Doyle Dane Bernbach on the Universal Pictures and MCA Television accounts and then worked on the client side of the business in marketing for Lorimar Home Video where he oversaw the development of marketing programs and sponsorship sales for their Entertainment group.
